raw.title: Bedrock - LTIPP [Post Council Feedback]
raw.author: 0xd333Bc5c9670C9cEb18f9A2CF02C6E86807a8227
raw.body:
Bedrock is submitting an amended proposal per the Clarified Process for Non-Council Recommended Applications.

In summary, Bedrock submitted a proposal to run an incentive program to encourage massive TVL growth $25m on Arbitrum, Defi integrations, and DeFi activity. 100% of the LTIPP grant will be used to incentivize users to restake on Arbitrum, provide LP into various DeFi protocols, and engage in other DeFi activities.The initial proposal did not pass the initial process by one vote with the feedback focusing on only two issues:

- A large ask (510k ARB)
- Too few details on how the grant distribution will occur and how stickiness post incentive period will be achieved.

Bedrock has now made amendments to the initial proposal, including:

- A reduced ask of 262k ARB
- A much more detailed and comprehensive approach to distribution, including the breakdown for different protocols and categories, based on both TVL and timeline.
- A more detailed section explaining how stickiness can be achieved not only to encourage success of this campaign, but to ensure continued growth well beyond the initial 12 weeks.

Link to Application Revisions:
https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/bedrock-ltipp-application-final/21865/6?u=gandalf

raw.title: Smilee Finance - LTIPP [Post Council Feedback]
raw.author: 0xd333Bc5c9670C9cEb18f9A2CF02C6E86807a8227
raw.body:
Following the feedback from the LTIPP Council, Smilee is submitting an amended proposal as per [Clarified Process for Non-Council Recommended Applications](https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/clarified-process-for-non-council-recommended-applications-to-move-to-snapshot/23257).

Summary of Council feedback received (excluding who voted yes):

* GMX: Expresses reservations regarding the proposal due project maturity, performance metrics, and grant size relative to current status.
* KAREL: Suggests resubmitting the proposal in a later grants window with a reduced ask after demonstrating greater traction.
* GFX: Argues against financing fee subsidies to a grantee, citing the finite nature of grants funding.

Smilee Protocol launched shortly before the LTIPP application program deadline, but lacked proper tracking tools to demonstrate performance and traction.
Given that Smilee launched on March 15th, as of today, Smilee has been live for slightly more than 5 weeks, (with one week of trading paused for redeploying new smart contracts) and has achieved the following performances:

* Total Value Locked (TVL): $2M (increased cap from $2M to $3M on April 11, 2024)
* Trading Volumes: $13.7M
* Premium: ~$67K for Liquidity Providers (LPs)
* Unique Traders: 166

Even though Smilee has not disclosed any incentives, their TVL increased by more than 15% in a period of market downtrend.

Full details here:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1kcWjdr5TIO6WJceUE5eQJXcPtCUnHWgD/edit#gid=1980618672

Source: https://defillama.com/protocol/smilee-finance#tvl-charts

**Detailed performance metrics can be viewed at:**

* [https://dune.com/0xpibs/smilee-dashboard
](https://dune.com/0xpibs/smilee-dashboard)- [https://defillama.com/protocol/smilee-finance#options-volume ](https://defillama.com/protocol/smilee-finance#options-volume) (Please note that volume tracking commenced on April 4th, and thus does not include the initial $4.5M traded before redeployment.)

In response to feedback from the Council and recent performance trends, they propose resubmitting the application with a reduced grant amount by eliminating the fee rebate component.

**Setting the new grant request at 140K ARB, Smilee will implement the following incentive scheme:**

* Grow Smilee TVL from $2M to $5M.
  * Incentives APR = ~14%, less than 15% as suggested;
  * USD Equivalent of Earn Incentives = ~165K USD (Assuming ARB Price of 1.18$)
  * ARB Equivalent of Earn Incentives = 140K ARB

**Final LTIPP request: 140,000 ARB**

raw.title: DODO LTIPP [Post Council Feedback]
raw.author: 0xe876a94EBAa0d8D2dA4142766d8C803a7C1D8ED8
raw.body:
DODO is submitting clarifications for our LTIPP proposal as detailed below.

The requested amount is **350k ARB**, which is 50% of the original request.

The original post and updated comments can be found here:

https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/dodo-ltipp-application-final/21842/6

### **Summary of Feedback from Votes Against:**

- Lack of detailed milestones and grant breakdown.
- Excessive grant size.
- No significant TVL growth over the years.

### **Responses and Updates:**

1. **We have reduced the grant request to 350k ARB, 50% of the original amount.**
    
    **Justification for Grant Size and Target Metrics**
    
    **Baseline and Target Metrics:**
    
    - **Current Metrics on Arbitrum:** Daily trading volume at $5M; TVL at $2M.
    - **Proposed Targets:** Increase daily trading volume to $15M and TVL to $6M, marking a 200% growth.
    
    **Strategic Rationale and Financial Calculations:**
    
    - **Historical Data & Market Potential:** Our past campaigns have consistently shown that targeted incentives lead to substantial growth in both trading volume and TVL. For instance, a previous initiative saw a 150% increase in TVL over a six-week period. This success underpins our confidence in achieving the set targets.
    - **Incentive Plans:**
        - **Liquidity Provider Incentives:** To achieve a $6M TVL with a competitive 20% APR, the required incentive is calculated at $1,200,000 annually. For the specific campaign period of 12 weeks, this translates to an estimated need of $266,666. At an ARB price of $1.15 (as of April 25, 2024), this equates to approximately 231,883 ARB tokens.
        - **Trading Volume Incentives:** Aiming for a $15M daily trading volume requires incentives for trading fee rebates projected at $130,000 over 12 weeks. This corresponds to about 113,043 ARB tokens, recalculated with the current ARB price of $1.15.
2. **We have added detailed milestones:**
    
    **Grant Timeline and Milestones:**
    
    - **Milestone 1:** Successfully deploy the dPoints system on Arbitrum. Announcement by the end of Week 1.
    - **Milestone 2:** Stablecoin pair TVL reaches $4 million, average daily volume reaches $6 million by the end of Week 4.
    - **Milestone 3:** Stablecoin pair TVL reaches $6 million, average daily volume reaches $10 million by the end of Week 8.
    - **Milestone 4:** Bridge stablecoin LP into the newly launched Orbit L3 DODOchain, ensuring sustainable TVL and trading volume for the pair after the incentive period ends by the end of Week 12.
3. **TVL growth**
    
    DODO has recently announced the launch of the [layer 3 solution DODOchain](https://x.com/DODO_chain/status/1782431708752859395), the first restaked rollup powered by Arbitrum Orbit, focusing on integrating liquidity from other chains. Securing this LTIPP grant will significantly boost the TVL and trading volume on Arbitrum, attracting new users from other ecosystems, who will lock up their assets through our LP pairs on Arbitrum and eventually bridge to DODOchain through the official Arbitrum Bridge.

raw.title: Rage Trade - LTIPP [Post Council Feedback]
raw.author: 0xB933AEe47C438f22DE0747D57fc239FE37878Dd1
raw.body:
### Summary
Rage Trade is submitting an amended proposal per the [Clarified Process for Non-Council Recommended Applications](https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/clarified-process-for-non-council-recommended-applications-to-move-to-snapshot/23257).
To recap, Rage Trade submitted [a proposal](https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/rage-trade-ltipp-application-final/21621) to run weekly and daily trading competitions in the LTIPP initial review round. The proposal aimed to allocate 100% of the LTIPP grant to onboard and reward users via these competitions. The focus was on trading competitions rather than fee rebates because competitions could significantly level the playing field  — ultimately boosting participation. The initial proposal was, however, declined by the council due to two issues: 
- A large ask (1.25M ARB)
- Too few details on how wash trading risks are handled during the competition.

Rage Trade has now made amendments to the initial proposal, including: 
- A reduced ask of 425k ARB 
- Highlighting already existing wash trading measures, including: 
   - Enforcing a minimum trade size
   - Calculating trader ROI based on the average collateral used during a competition round to ensure fairness between large and small traders

Link to Application Revisions:
https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/rage-trade-ltipp-application-final/21621/14

### Revised feedback:
- [GFXlabs](https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/rage-trade-ltipp-application-final/21621/15):
> As one of the initial reviewers, we feel our concerns were addressed and would score this proposal considerably higher. The applicant correctly identified and revised the areas of the grant plan we scored as the weakest and would likely receive a passing grade from GFX if reevaluated formally.
As a reminder, the LTIP pilot rules did not allow applicants the ability to revise after formal submission, and so were not able to react to feedback in real time from reviewers.
As a second reminder, all reviewers have their own opinions and views, and may or may not overlap on some topics.
- [404DAO](https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/rage-trade-ltipp-application-final/21621/16):
> As another reviewer of Rage Trade’s application, we also echo that our initial concerns have been addressed with these revisions. In addition to the revised grant size, Rage Trade has provided a more detailed execution plan that now includes prize distributions and the allocation breakdown between Daily & Weekly competitions. Lastly, we are pleased to see additional thought put towards preventing wash trading in the competitions.
As a delegate, we will be supporting this application once it goes live for a vote.
- [Coinflip](https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/rage-trade-ltipp-application-final/21621/17):
> Rage Trade has been a long time integration partner of GMX supporting us with various vaults and now aggregation solutions. I’m glad to see them having taken the feedback from the LTIPP council and brought forward a much improved proposal including revised sizing.
Glad to confirm support as a delegate for this proposal.

### Key Rage Trade v2 Stats 
- **Total Volume Traded**: $500 Million 
- **Launch Date**: 30th November 2023 (~5 months since launch)
- **Number of Perps Integrated**: Five (GMX, Hyperliquid, Aevo, dYdX, Synthetix)
- **Number of Traders**: >3000

raw.title: Steadefi LTIPP Council Recommended Proposal
raw.author: 0xF92F185AbD9E00F56cb11B0b709029633d1E37B4
raw.body:
Steadefi LTIPP Council Recommended Proposal
## Link to Application
https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/steadefi-ltipp-application-draft/21663

## Council -  3/5 Yes Votes

### Feedback

*Wintermute Feedback)*
Steadefi’s application provided clear calculations and justifications for their grant size, milestones, KPIs, and goals. Their project builds on top of GMX adding additional utility to the protocol.
Their requested grant size seems reasonable given the current TVL, however, some of their TVL goals are a bit ambitious. Their execution strategy is clear with a detailed list of vaults and pools they will be focusing on.
We would’ve liked to have seen some more innovation on the incentive side with a focus on stickiness. Nonetheless, we think the application is sufficient enough to progress to a DAO vote.

*GFX Feedback)*
The applicant has shown recent signs of growth, and we would like to support increasing that. To that end, it would have been helpful if the applicant identified specific mechanisms that they attribute current or past successes to, and then tailored their grant plan specifically to replicating or scaling that success. Given the size of the grant request, we prefer to see some data to validate a specific execution plan.

*Karel Feedback)*
"Vote AGAINST Steadefi's proposal.

Detailed proposal who has shown impressive growth since launching v2. Gitcoin Passport implementation is interest to protect against sybils. The grant size on its own is reasonable but do not feel it has been sufficiently justified to effectively 10x TVL by the end of the LTIPP (across both lending and strategy vaults). Much of the justification was drawn around the target and associated assumptions to fill in the blanks to form a path to get there vs. drawing from data to execute against."		

*GMX Feedback)*
The proposal from Steadefi outlines a comprehensive plan to attract and retain liquidity within the Arbitrum ecosystem through incentivizing users and providing innovative leverage yield strategies. Their detailed roadmap, including specific milestones and KPIs, demonstrates a clear path to achieving their objectives. Additionally, the team's past performance, security measures, and engagement with the community instill confidence in their ability to execute on their plans. The requested grant size and justification are reasonable given their projected impact on TVL and user growth. Overall, Steadefi's proposal aligns well with the objectives of achieving  growth and making it a strong candidate for approval. 

*404 Feedback)*
Steadefi presented a strong application that covered all components of the rubric. Their current usage is a little low for the grant ask and their execution strategy could have used more justification/reasoning behind how they have chosen their pools. However, their proactive approach to sybil attacks by using Gitcoin passport is a plus and we believe this likely leads to a lower grant claim than allocated. Their milestones are effectively designed to measure their success and we appreciate their feasibility component in justifying each KPI. We will be supporting this application.

decision.summary: The proposal to grant Clipper 174,308 ARB aims to incentivize liquidity farming and migration of existing LPs to Arbitrum, targeting a doubling of TVL with a carefully justified incentive plan. Timeline analytics show early and stable strong support for 'For' votes. Forum sentiment is mixed but mostly neutral, with some negative feedback on grant size and execution clarity, though supporters note improved revisions and justified goals. Historical similar proposals with strong 'For' support succeeded in increasing TVL without detrimental market effects, supporting this proposal's goals.
key_arguments_for: Clipper's unique formula market maker eliminates impermanent loss and toxic bot activity, providing better yields and lower slippage.
The grant will fund liquidity farming to grow Arbitrum TVL from $1.11M to approx. $2.4M, improving price competitiveness for most trades.
Migration incentives target existing LPs on other chains, expanding the user base and increasing stickiness with an 8-week charge-up period.
Similar past proposals with LTIPP support showed positive voting outcomes and stable market conditions, indicating feasibility.
key_arguments_against: Some council members and forum participants view the requested grant size as large relative to current TVL and question speculative growth assumptions.
Concerns about clarity and sufficiency of execution milestones and data reliability remain among some abstaining voters.
The proposal's use of a fixed ARB price for calculations is seen as outdated given market dynamics.
Negative forum sentiment reflects skepticism about the justification for incentives and growth projections.

evidence.quote: 15 posts with mixed sentiment: 1 positive, 5 negative, 9 neutral. Early comments detail proposal strengths and team expertise; later comments include concerns about grant size and execution plans.
Strong early and stable lead for 'For' option with 100% lead ratio in first quartile and high stability metrics.

evidence.reference: Adjacent similar proposals from LTIPP program
evidence.quote: Past proposals with similar scope and strong 'For' voting resulted in positive vote margins and did not negatively impact TVL or token price.

decision.simulation_reason: Recommendation based on timeline analysis and forum sentiment overrules ex-post tally to maximize long-term organizational health.
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'For' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Timeline analytics show strong and stable early support for 'For' votes, indicating robust community backing.
- Forum sentiment is mixed but the majority is neutral; negative sentiments highlight concerns about grant size and execution but acknowledge improved proposal clarity.
- Similar past LTIPP proposals with 'For' outcomes achieved their goals without adverse market effects, supporting the feasibility and benefit of this grant.
- The recommendation aligns with the majority of voting power and targets durable growth in TVL and user base, outweighing some dissenting views.
- The recommendation mirrors aggregated sentiment in favor but advises caution on grant size and execution monitoring.
